ca.ualberta.cs.drivr

Class SearchRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.cs.drivr.SearchRequest

  • public class SearchRequest
extends java.lang.Object
    In SearchRequest, a driver is able to search for open requests based on a few factors. The driver can specify the minimum fare, the maximum fare, the minimum price per KM, the maximum price per KM, the location to search nearby for requests going to and from there and keywords that are contained in the requests description. When the driver specifies what they want to search by, the app will go into any of the four functions (searchLocation, searchKeyword, filterByPrice, filterByPriceKm), get the requests as necessary or take the requests and trim them down based on whether or not they match all given parameters.
    See Also:
    ElasticSearch, SearchRequestActivity, SearchRequestsListActivity

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Request> getRequests(android.content.Context context)
      Here, the requests for the given parameters will be gotten by creating a new ArrayList of requests, setting the context and connectivityManager and then going into SearchKeyword(), SearchLocation(), filterByPrice() and filterByPriceKm() if the parameters are filled.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchRequest

        public SearchRequest(java.lang.String minPrice,
                     java.lang.String maxPrice,
                     java.lang.String minPricePer,
                     java.lang.String maxPricePer,
                     ConcretePlace location,
                     java.lang.String keyword)
        Here, the class is instantiated with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        minPrice - String of the minimum fare a driver will accept
        maxPrice - String of the maximum fare a driver will accept
        minPricePer - String of the minimum fare per KM a driver will accept
        maxPricePer - String of the maximum fare per KM a driver will accept
        location - ConcretePlace of the address and geolocaton a driver wants to search nearby
        keyword - String of the keyword the driver wants to search for

    • Method Detail

      • getRequests

        public java.util.ArrayList<Request> getRequests(android.content.Context context)
        Here, the requests for the given parameters will be gotten by creating a new ArrayList of requests, setting the context and connectivityManager and then going into SearchKeyword(), SearchLocation(), filterByPrice() and filterByPriceKm() if the parameters are filled. After going through those filters and searches, the ArrayList of requests is returned.
        Parameters:
        context - The context of the program to allow for checking the ConnectivityManager.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of open requests matching the given parameters.
